1:
It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh
\q and to sing praises to your name, Most High,
\q
2:
to proclaim your covenant faithfulness in the morning
\q and your truthfulness every night,
\q
3:
with a harp of ten strings
\q and with the melody of the lyre.
4:
For you, Yahweh, have made me glad through your deeds.
\q I will sing for joy because of the deeds of your hands.
\q
5:
How great are your deeds, Yahweh!
\q Your thoughts are very deep.
6:
A brutish person does not know,
\q nor does a fool understand this:
\q
7:
When the wicked sprout like the grass,
\q and even when all the evildoers thrive,
\q still they are doomed to eternal destruction.
8:
But you, Yahweh, will reign forever.
\q
9:
Indeed, look at your enemies, Yahweh!
\q Indeed, look at your enemies. They will perish!
\q All those who do evil will be scattered.
11:
My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies;
\q my ears have heard of the doom of my evil foes.
13:
They are planted in the house of Yahweh;
\q they flourish in the courts of our God.
15:
to proclaim that Yahweh is just.
\q He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
92:
\m
\d A psalm, a song for the Sabbath day.
\q
